subject: Self Care
title: The Four Stages of Sleep
description: Learn The Four Stages of Sleep in one minute.

hook.text: You think you just close your eyes and that's it. In reality, your brain runs four distinct stages.

buildup.text: Stage 1 is light drowsiness. Stage 2 is true sleep. Stage 3 is deep, restorative slow-wave sleep.

discovery.text: Stage 4 is REM â€” rapid eye movement â€” where vivid dreams happen and emotional memories are processed.

twist.text: You cycle through all four stages roughly every 90 minutes. Waking mid-cycle causes grogginess.

climax.text: Deep sleep dominates early cycles. REM dominates later ones. Both are essential for full recovery.

punchline.text: Sleep has four acts. You need every one.

quiz.question: During which sleep stage do vivid dreams occur?
